page.title: 04CUFFLEY'S OTHER CHURCHES.
page.content: CUFFLEY FREE CHURCH. Some Baptists first met in the Cabin in 1937.when the war was over they bought some land on the corner of Plough Hill and King James Avenue and some services were held in an old hut. Building of the church began in 1968 and was completed the following year. it cost Â£28000. The old hut is now used as the church hall. The Rev.J. Lambert became minister of the church in March 1966. CUFFLEY ROMAN CATHOLIC CHURCH. After the war, a few Roman Catholics in Cuffley met for sermons in the Cabin.But as the population increased they had to build a proper church and the small church of St.Martin de Porres,in Church Close,was built and opened in 1962.
